fields.value: Population and Housing Census of Hong Kong, 1971: 1/100 Household Sample (M098V1)

authorName.value: Hong Kong. Colonial Secretariat. Finance Branch

dsDescriptionValue.value: From the codebook: "The Hong Kong 1971 Population and Housing Census was a de facto count. Thus, all persons who were in Hong Kong at the census moment were enumerated. The operation was conducted by specially trained enumerators using the two-visit method and was preceded by three pilot or trial censuses, two land and one marine. The sample records were selected on an every hundredth household basis and excluded marine data.  There were twenty-one questions pertaining to personal data and nine concerning household data.  The questions were designed to obtian informaiton on four major groups of population characteristics and the inter-relation.  These groups were housing, demographic, economic, and transport."

fields.value: Subject: STANDARD DEPOSIT TERMS 1.0  Type: DATAPASS:TERMS:STANDARD:1.0  Notes: of the Archive), within the Data Preservation Alliance for the Social Sciences ("Data-PASS") in accordance with the Data-PASS terms (the "Terms") of use (available from: http://www.icpsr.org/Data-PASS). producerAffiliation.value: United Nations Economic and Social Commission for Asia and the Pacific

distributorAffiliation.value: United Nations Economic and Social Commission for Asia and the Pacific, Statistics Division

value: Census and Statistics Department (C&SD), The Government of Hong Kong Special Administrative Region:  http://www.censtatd.gov.hk/home/index.jsp
Individuals in Hong Kong, Hong Kong Island, Kowloon, New Kowloon, New Territories and Rural Districts.

fields.value:
Survey containing twenty-one questions pertaining to personal data and nine concerning household data. The questions were designed to obtain information on four major groups of population characteristics and their interrelation. These groups were housing, demographic, economic, and transport. The sample records were selected on an every 100th household basis and excluded marine data

The prefix "H" is used to designate household fields, the letter "P" population items.
"The operation was conducted by specially trained enumerators using the two-visit method and was preceded by three pilot or trial censuses, two land and one marine.
Structured. Example is present in documentation.
